title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Thursday 5 January 2017 - BBC News
summary: husband and wife found dead at dunkeswell property .
plymouth argyle director pledges more than £ 4m for new stand .
derriford hospital on highest possible alert due to number of patients .
lorry driver has 'very serious ' injuries after a30 slip road crash .
two children and man rescued from house fire in plymouth .
royal cornwall hospital at 'level 4 ' and asking people not to visit a & e unless it 's life threatening .
ammunition belt found by dartmoor walker .
bude is set to become a home for up to two families of syrian refugees after a community fundraising project .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: our live coverage
text: that 's all from bbc local live in devon & cornwall for today , we 'll be back at 08:00 to bring you all the day 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
do n't miss bbc spotlight at 18:30 and the late bulletin at 22:30 tonight .

documents.title: derriford hospital on highest alert level
text: derriford hospital in plymouth is on the highest level of alert - level 4 - .
which means hospital services are unable to cope with demand .
a hospital spokesman said : `` this week has been even busier than we anticipated , largely due to the number of sick patients who are coming to our emergency department . ''
the hospital said there had been `` a knock-on effect on the demand for beds within the entire hospital '' .
the level 4 status was previously referred to as being 'on black alert ' .
the royal cornwall hospital in truro confirmed yesterday it had moved to level 4 status .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: butcher un-retires himself
text: a retired butcher from cornwall says he was so bored and lonely when he shut his shop that he just had to reopen it .
73 year old ralph michell - who ran the shop for decades at calenick near truro - was inspired by the story of the 89 year old man in devon , joe bartley who put an ad out for work .
he is now working at a cafe in paignton .
it made him think , by comparison , he 's a young man .
so two years after the doors closed , he 's back trading again .
author: Laurence Reed
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: harrad and reid agree torquay deals
text: torquay united have signed striker shaun harrad and extended the loan of exeter city forward jamie reid until the end of the season .
harrad , 32 , rejoins the gulls after leaving wrexham , subject to international clearance , having spent the second half of 2015-16 at torquay .
he comes in to replace nathan blissett , who is set to move to plymouth argyle , while reid , 22 , who moved to plainmoor on loan in the summer , has scored three times in 26 national league games .
`` i was delighted to get the call and be here to help the club progress up the league table , '' harrad told bbc sport .

`` i want to help us finish as high as possible , there are some talented players who came in here over the summer and we 're looking to get some consistency into the performances to progress and get up that league table . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: dead husband and wife named locally
text: a husband and wife found dead at a farmhouse in devon have been named locally as nicola and michael beck .
their bodies were discovered at the farmhouse in countryside near dunkerswell abbey in the early hours of the morning .
scenes of crime officers and search teams have been on site all day .
police are not looking for anybody else in connection with the bodies .
author: Kirk England
BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: more knives handed over after amnesty
text: these knives were handed in at falmouth police station yesterday .
it follows a knife amnesty that lasted for six days in november across devon and cornwall .
more than 200 knives were handed in across the force area .
the amnesty was prompted by legislation that banned the sale or importation of 'zombie knives ' .

documents.title: severe delays in bodmin area
text: severe delays in bodmin area

documents.title: military items left on dartmoor 'a rare occurrence '
text: a belt of blank rifle cartridges , a glove , camouflage and knee pads have all been found by a walker on dartmoor .
they were found by steve granger near doe tor on the willsworthy firing range in north dartmoor on wednesday .
the mod said : we have collected the items found by mr granger .
before they begin training , all exercising personnel are reminded not to leave anything behind on dartmoor and training area staff conduct sweeps to check for items left .
`` military items being left on dartmoor is therefore a rare occurrence but unfortunately items are occasionally missed .
`` we would therefore like to remind the public not to touch any items they find , as they may be dangerous .
anything found should be reported to 01837 657210 and will be safely removed by mod personnel . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: shot cat has leg amputated
text: shocking photos have been released of a st blazey cat which was brutally attacked and left riddled by shotgun pellets .
gringo has had to have his leg amputated and needs more treatment .
he arrived at sally 's cat rescue centre in st austell on 22 december with multiple injuries .
well-wishers have raised more than a thousand pounds for his vets bills .

documents.title: breakingargyle director funds new stand at home park
text: plymouth argyle director simon hallett has invested £ 4.1m into the club to help finance the building of a new grandstand at home park .
the plymouth-born american-based businessman has increased his stake in the league two club to 41.9 % , the second-largest shareholder behind owner and chairman james brent .

hallett will be repaid over the next 30 years at a rate 'less than 3 % ' and all the loans currently owed to hallett , brent and director tony wrathall have been turned into equity in the club , reducing argyle 's debt level .
`` it 's a labour of love for me , '' hallett , who has supported the club for over 50 years , told bbc south west .

`` the new investment made by me is clearly not made on commercial terms , it 's been made on very soft terms , so it 's mine and my wife 's contribution to plymouth argyle and towards the city of plymouth . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: breaking'murder and suicide ' of husband and wife
text: police are treating the discovery of two bodies in devon as a `` domestic related murder and suicide '' .
officers found the bodies of a man , 62 , and his 52-year-old wife at a property at dunkeswell in east devon shortly before midnight yesterday .
devon and cornwall police said they are not looking for anybody else in connection with the deaths .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: plymouth argyle sign torquay 's blissett
text: plymouth argyle have signed torquay united striker nathan blissett .
the pilgrims have paid the gulls an initial fee of £ 15,000 for the target man , the first player argyle have paid a fee for since the summer of 2012 .
the 26-year-old has scored four goals for torquay this season and scored eight times in 17 games last season as he helped the gulls avoid relegation .
blissett joined national league torquay in january 2016 , and signed a new deal at plainmoor in the summer .
argyle has not disclosed the length of the former bristol rovers striker 's contract .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: rates rise may lead to price hikes
text: the price of food and goods from small businesses in cornwall may increase because of a big rise in business rates in some parts of the county .
anne vandermulen from the federation of small businesses in cornwall says shops and cafes may have to increase their prices or shed staff to be able to afford the rise in rates .
in areas like st ives and wadebridge the rates will go up this year because of a reassessment based on the latest property prices .
in other towns such as bodmin and penzance they 're expected to fall .

documents.title: lorry driver has 'very serious ' injuries
text: police say the driver of a lorry that partially overturned on a slip road near bodmin this morning has been taken to derriford hospital with `` very serious lower leg injuries '' .
the accident happened at about 09:00 this morning .
the lorry is partially resting on a railway bridge which is causing problems for the emergency services .
a crane and other removal vehicles are on site .
there is major traffic congestion in the bodmin area as a result of the crash , combined with roadworks at temple and in the town centre .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: residents object to plans for four storey block of flats replacing pub in henver road
text: residents have objected to plans to transform a former pub on one of newquay 's main roads into a four-storey block of flats .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: two bodies found in east devon : what we know so far
text: two bodies found in east devon : what we know so far
author: Kirk England
BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: latest travel across devon and cornwall
text: latest travel across devon and cornwall
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: can you help solve the mystery of these memorial plaques found on porthtowan beach ?
text: a search is on for relatives of two people named on memorial plaques found on a beach by a family who have lovingly restored them .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: penzance on global 'places to go ' list
text: penzance is `` having a moment '' according to the new york times who place the town 14th on its '52 places to go in 2017 ' list .

the author david shaftel writes `` penzance , the cornish port town in the southwest of england is having a moment thanks to the popularity of 'poldark ' , the bbc costume drama set in 18th-century cornwall '' .
the article recommends visiting the jubilee pool , as well as some local accommodation and restaurants .
canada tops the list , with the atacama desert in chile in second place .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: council jobs freeze in bid to plug £ 8.1million of overspending
text: a jobs freeze is being introduced by devon county council to manage a projected budget overspend .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: afternoon weather forecasts
text: afternoon weather forecasts
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: iphone 'stolen ' from teenage crash victim
text: a man has been arrested on sus of stealing an iphone from a teenager as she lay in the street with two broken legs after being hit by a car .
ruby-tuesday hobbs , 18 , was hit by a suspected drink-driver on christmas eve near drake circus in plymouth .
police confirmed they arrested a 35-year-old man in plymouth yesterday on sus of the theft of a mobile phone .
he was released on bail until 1 february .
miss hobbs is understood to be receiving treatment at derriford hospital in plymouth for multiple fractures to her legs .
a 27-year-old man from plymouth was previously arrested on sus of causing serious injury by dangerous driving and driving under the influence and bailed until 23 january .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: congestion on a30 at bodmin
text: there remains heavy congestion on the eastbound carriageway of the a30 near bodmin after a lorry crash on a slip road .
highways england expect it to remain busy until early afternoon .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: gunshots 'fired over cornwall hunt riders '
text: a wildlife charity is investigating claims a member of staff fired a shotgun over the heads of a hunt .
cornwall wildlife trust confirmed that it was investigating the claims by north cornwall hunt against the man .
police said they had spoken to the charity worker but concluded there had been `` no crime '' .
a video from a member of the hunt appears to show four shots being fired near the hunt , spooking horses , with spent shot raining down on the riders .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: police guard remains around property where two bodies found
text: a police guard remains in place around a property in east devon after officers found the bodies of a man and woman inside .
police went to the property in dunkeswell just before midnight last night following concerns for welfare .
officers say they are not looking for anyone else in connection with the deaths .
author: Kirk England
BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: mp fury at 'appalling ' rates rise
text: a cornish mp has branded as `` appalling '' rates rises that some st ives businesses say could force them to close .
it 's after a nationwide government review of business rates that 's left some having to find hundred of pounds more every month from april .
ministers say it makes the system fairer and nearly three quarters of companies across the country will see no change or a fall in their bills .
st ives mp derek thomas says it is unfair on some local businesses .
author: Tamsin Melville
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: government backs bude refugee homing campaigners
text: the government has welcomed a campaign by a bude group to home two families of syrian refugees .
bude refugee support group has raised £ 15,000 so far and are confident of doubling this amount .
its plans are supported by the government 's community sponsorship scheme and have been welcomed by the minister of state for immigration , robert goodwill mp .
he accepts that some people may be uncomfortable with refugee families moving close to them but has urged communities to support the initiative .
`` having been out in these camps to see the dreadful conditions that these people are living in and as a country we have a long tradition of charitable help , '' he said .
there 's more here on the issue of homing refugees .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: man arrested on sus of stealing phone from crash teenager
text: a man has been arrested on sus of stealing a gold-coloured iphone as a teenage girl lay suffering multiple fractures to her legs after she collided with a car , according to the plymouth herald .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: filling up - where are the most expensive and cheapest places in devon ?
text: petrol and diesel prices rose by about 3p a litre in december taking them to their highest average prices since july 2015 .
apparently woolacombe in north devon is one of the most expensive places in the country to buy fuel .
well radio devon wants to hear from you about this .
how expensive ( or cheap ) is it where you live in the county ?
let us know on facebook , twitter , or email so we can put together a list of the prices right across devon .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: thousands raised for student whose family died in house fire before christmas
text: thousands of pounds has been raised for a devon student whose family died in a tragic house fire before christmas .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: lorry crash on a30 slip road
text: a lorry crash on a slip road to the a30 near bodmin is causing delays .
police believe the road will be closed for several hours .

documents.title: ammunition belt found by dartmoor walker
text: a belt of blank rifle cartridges has been found by a walker on dartmoor .
the belt was found by steve granger near doe tor on the willsworthy firing range in north dartmoor on wednesday .
he said he had contacted the army which would be collecting the ammo and other equipment including a glove , camouflage and knee pads today .
steve , 42 , from okehampton , said : `` i have found military debris in the past but it 's always been fired ammunition .
`` it looks as if it has been used in night training and has been left behind . ''
the mod has been contacted for a response .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: a30 slip road 'shut for hours ' after hgv crash
text: a30 slip road 'shut for hours ' after hgv crash

documents.title: unannounced inspection at hospital
text: the care quality commission is carrying out an unannounced inspection at the royal cornwall hospital 's trust .
nineteen inspectors arrived on wednesday and are expected to complete their work later today .
last january , the trust received an overall rating of 'requires improvement ' .
the trust is currently at 'level 4 ' , formerly known as 'black alert ' .
people are being asked not to attend a & e except in life threatening circumstances .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: hodges worried at poor truro city form
text: truro city manager lee hodges says he is concerned about his team 's poor run of form in national league south .
the white tigers have lost four successive league games , having not got a victory since 19 november , and have slumped to 16th in the division , two points above the relegation places .
`` it is worrying because we 've got to get those points on the board as quickly as possible , '' hodges said .
`` we 've been in every game that we 've played in and at times we 've dominated .
we have to make that domination count and put teams to bed , because we are creating chances , '' he added to bbc radio cornwall .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: torbay hospital on 'red alert '
text: a post christmas rush of patients put torbay hospital on red alert on wednesday .
author: Torquay Herald Express

documents.title: breakinga30 exit slip road closed after lorry overturns
text: breakinga30 exit slip road closed after lorry overturns

documents.title: family life on film for triple-amputee mark ormrod
text: most little boys want to be just like daddy and mason is no exception !
his father is plymouth former royal marine mark ormrod , who 's trying to get a fly-on-the-wall documentary made about his life as a triple amputee .
hear him on radio devon with fitz after 11 today .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: tom returns to plymouth to meet fitness book fans
text: plymouth 's tom daley will be back in his home city today .
the olympic diver and tv presenter will be signing copies of his new health and fitness book at drake circus , in a ticketed event .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: exeter train ticket inspectors told to catch 28 fare dodgers a month
text: exeter train ticket inspectors have to catch 28 people a month dodging their rail fares , or face being put on review , it has been revealed .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: hospital asks people not to visit a & e unless it 's life threatening
text: people are being asked to think carefully about whether they need to go to accident and emergency as pressure mounts at hospitals across the region with many at the highest level of alert , which means they 're struggling to cope with the number of patients .
the royal cornwall hospital at treliske is on level 4 - formerly known as black alert - and is asking people not to visit a & e unless it 's life threatening .
it 's also having to consider cancelling some operations .
derriford hospital is at level 3 .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police find two bodies in devon home
text: police have launched an investigation after officers found two bodies - one of a man and one of a woman - at a property in east devon .
the bodies were found on wednesday at a home in dunkeswell .
det supt ken lamont said : this investigation is at a very early stage and enquiries continue to establish the circumstances around the deaths .
however at this time we are not looking for any other person in connection with this incident . ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: bude campaigners raise £ 15,000 for syrian refugees
text: campaigners have raised £ 15,000 to re-home people from war-torn syria .
bude in north cornwall is set to become a home for up to two families of syrian refugees after a community fundraising project by the bude refugee support group .
the 30-strong group is confident of doubling the amount raised so far .
chair mary whibley said : `` their plight is desperate .
seeing those awful in july 2015 of migrants drowning really pulled at our hearts .
`` just to take in two families when every summer bude has thousands of visitors and we do n't bat an eyelid . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: packed public meeting on future of hospital care in north devon
text: the future of hospital care in north devon drew hundreds of people to a packed public meeting last night .
campaigners fear some acute services at north devon district hospital could be closed , and moved to exeter or plymouth .
health bosses say no decisions have yet been made and local people will be consulted .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: king harry ferry company falriver plans to open a floating cafe on the river fal this summer
text: the river fal is to set to have a permanent floating cafe which will only be accessible by the water .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: breakingman and woman found dead at dunkeswell house
text: a man and a woman have been found dead at a house in devon .
police are treating the deaths of the pair in dunkeswell as `` unexplained '' and are not looking for anyone in connection with the deaths .
the bodies were found at 11:40 gmt on wednesday said police who received calls raising `` concerns for the welfare of a man and woman at the property '' .
next of kin have been informed .
the scene has been cordoned off for a forensic examination .
det supt ken lamont said investigations were at a `` very early stage '' .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: bude welcomes refugee families
text: bude could be the first town in cornwall to provide a home for syrian refugees under the government 's community sponsorship scheme .
the 30-strong bude refugee support group has raised thousands of pounds to offer a home in bude for up to two families of syrian refugees .
the plans have been welcomed by the minister of state for immigration , robert goodwill .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: weather outlook for devon and cornwall : generally cloudy with occasional bright spells
text: it will be a largely cloudy day , although there will perhaps be some brightness , particularly across eastern parts .
winds will be light though and temperatures will be fairly mild .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Emily Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines for devon and cornwall
text: headlines for devon and cornwall
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: st ives businesses 'unfairly penalised by business rates hike '
text: shop owners in st ives say they 're being unfairly penalised as they face big business rate rises this year .
some firms will see their bills hiked by hundreds of pounds a month from april after a government review to reflect changes in the property market .
ministers said it made the system fairer , and nearly 75 % of companies nationwide would see no change or a fall .
but there are warnings some in the town could be forced out of business .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: children and man rescued from house blaze
text: two children and a man have been rescued from a house fire in plymouth .
they were trapped on the top floor of the property , while the ground floor was on fire .
the blaze started in a three storey house in south milton street just after 01:00 .
fire crews used a ladder to rescue them through a window .
a woman was already outside the property .
all four have been treated after breathing in smoke and taken to hospital to be checked over .
the fire is now out .
author: Alison Johns, BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for thursday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online
